newsitem.title: POLAND: SAB , POLISH FIRM BUY TYCHY BREWER.
newsitem.headline: SAB , POLISH FIRM BUY TYCHY BREWER.

text.p: A company formed by South African Breweries Ltd (SAB) and Poland's Euro Agro Centrum SA late on Monday bought a 52 percent stake in the Polish Tychy brewery for $75 million, the privatisation ministry said.
It said in a statement that under the agreement the company, Kompania Piwna SA, pledged to invest a further $75 million in Tychy, but planned to invest at least $115 million over the next five years.
The funds would be spent on boosting Tychy's production potential, improving its distribution network and marketing.
Kampania Piwna SA wants to invest $26 million in Tychy within the next 12 months, the statement said.
The firm agreed to keep Tychy's jobs for four years and raise wages.
